sections.name: Murder in the First Degree
sections.text: The unlawful killing of a human being with malice aforethought and premeditation. **First degree murder** requires deliberate intent and planning. This includes killings that are willful, deliberate, and premeditated, or that occur during the commission of certain felonies. [cite: LSPC 1-101]

sections.name: Murder in the Second Degree
sections.text: The unlawful killing of a human being with malice aforethought but without premeditation. **Second degree murder** includes intentional killings that are not premeditated and killings resulting from dangerous conduct. [cite: LSPC 1-102]

sections.name: Voluntary Manslaughter
sections.text: The unlawful killing of a human being without malice aforethought, committed in the heat of passion or upon sudden provocation. **Voluntary manslaughter** occurs when a person kills in response to adequate provocation. [cite: LSPC 1-103]

sections.name: Involuntary Manslaughter
sections.text: The unlawful killing of a human being without malice aforethought, committed without intent to kill but as a result of criminal negligence or during the commission of a misdemeanor. [cite: LSPC 1-104]

sections.name: Assault with a Deadly Weapon
sections.text: An intentional act that creates a reasonable apprehension of imminent harmful contact using a deadly weapon. **Deadly weapons** include firearms, knives, vehicles when used as weapons, or any object capable of causing death or great bodily harm. [cite: LSPC 1-105]

sections.name: Aggravated Assault
sections.text: An assault committed with the intent to commit a felony or that results in serious bodily injury. **Aggravated assault** involves circumstances that make the crime more serious than simple assault. [cite: LSPC 1-106]

sections.name: Battery
sections.text: The willful and unlawful use of force or violence upon another person. **Battery** requires actual physical contact or touching of another person in a harmful or offensive manner. [cite: LSPC 1-107]

sections.name: Kidnapping
sections.text: The unlawful taking and carrying away of another person by force, fraud, or intimidation with intent to detain them against their will. **Kidnapping** includes false imprisonment with movement of the victim. [cite: LSPC 1-108]

sections.name: Domestic Violence
sections.text: Any willful infliction of physical injury upon a current or former spouse, cohabitant, or person with whom the perpetrator has a dating relationship. **Domestic violence** includes threats and emotional abuse patterns. [cite: LSPC 1-109]

sections.name: Stalking
sections.text: Willfully, maliciously, and repeatedly following or harassing another person with credible threats that would cause a reasonable person to fear for their safety. **Stalking** includes cyberstalking and surveillance. [cite: LSPC 1-110]

sections.name: Grand Theft
sections.text: The unlawful taking of another person's property valued at more than $950 with intent to permanently deprive the owner. **Grand theft** includes theft of vehicles, firearms, and property taken from a person. [cite: LSPC 2-201]

sections.name: Petty Theft
sections.text: The unlawful taking of another person's property valued at $950 or less with intent to permanently deprive the owner. **Petty theft** is a misdemeanor offense for low-value property crimes. [cite: LSPC 2-202]

sections.name: Burglary in the First Degree
sections.text: Unlawful entry into an inhabited dwelling with intent to commit theft or any felony. **First degree burglary** applies to residential structures where people live or sleep. [cite: LSPC 2-203]

sections.name: Burglary in the Second Degree
sections.text: Unlawful entry into any building, vehicle, or structure with intent to commit theft or any felony. **Second degree burglary** applies to commercial and uninhabited structures. [cite: LSPC 2-204]

sections.name: Robbery in the First Degree
sections.text: The unlawful taking of property from another person through force or threat of force while armed with a deadly weapon. **Armed robbery** carries enhanced penalties due to weapon involvement. [cite: LSPC 2-205]

sections.name: Robbery in the Second Degree
sections.text: The unlawful taking of property from another person through force or threat of force without use of a deadly weapon. **Unarmed robbery** involves intimidation or physical force without weapons. [cite: LSPC 2-206]

sections.name: Motor Vehicle Theft
sections.text: The unlawful taking of a motor vehicle belonging to another with intent to permanently or temporarily deprive the owner. **Vehicle theft** includes carjacking and joyriding. [cite: LSPC 2-207]

sections.name: Arson
sections.text: Willfully and maliciously setting fire to or burning any structure, forest land, or property. **Arson** includes burning one's own property if it endangers others or is done to defraud insurance. [cite: LSPC 2-208]

sections.name: Vandalism
sections.text: Willfully damaging, destroying, or defacing property belonging to another. **Vandalism** includes graffiti, property destruction, and defacement of public or private property. [cite: LSPC 2-209]

sections.name: Fraud
sections.text: Intentionally deceiving another person for financial gain by misrepresenting facts or concealing material information. **Fraud** includes identity theft, credit card fraud, and check fraud. [cite: LSPC 2-210]

sections.name: Possession of Controlled Substances
sections.text: Unlawful possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription. **Controlled substances** are classified by schedules based on medical use and potential for abuse. Personal use quantities may receive reduced penalties. [cite: LSPC 3-301]

sections.name: Possession with Intent to Distribute
sections.text: Possession of controlled substances in quantities or circumstances indicating intent to sell or distribute. **Intent to distribute** may be inferred from quantity, packaging, paraphernalia, or other evidence. [cite: LSPC 3-302]

sections.name: Sale of Controlled Substances
sections.text: The unlawful sale, delivery, or transfer of any controlled substance. **Drug dealing** penalties increase based on the type and quantity of substance sold and proximity to schools or parks. [cite: LSPC 3-303]

sections.name: Manufacturing Controlled Substances
sections.text: The unlawful production, cultivation, or synthesis of controlled substances. **Drug manufacturing** includes operating drug labs, growing marijuana operations, and synthesizing illegal drugs. [cite: LSPC 3-304]

sections.name: Trafficking in Controlled Substances
sections.text: The large-scale distribution, transportation, or importation of controlled substances. **Drug trafficking** involves commercial quantities and organized distribution networks. [cite: LSPC 3-305]

sections.name: Possession of Drug Paraphernalia
sections.text: Possession of equipment, materials, or devices used for consuming, manufacturing, or distributing controlled substances. **Drug paraphernalia** includes pipes, scales, syringes, and manufacturing equipment. [cite: LSPC 3-306]

sections.name: Under the Influence of Controlled Substances
sections.text: Being under the influence of any controlled substance in a public place or while operating a vehicle. **Public intoxication** from illegal drugs is a misdemeanor with treatment options available. [cite: LSPC 3-307]

sections.name: Prescription Fraud
sections.text: Fraudulently obtaining or attempting to obtain controlled substances through forged prescriptions, doctor shopping, or misrepresentation. **Prescription fraud** includes altering prescriptions and pharmacy theft. [cite: LSPC 3-308]

sections.name: Illegal Possession of Firearms
sections.text: Possession of any firearm by a person prohibited from owning firearms or possession without proper licensing. **Prohibited persons** include felons, persons with restraining orders, and those with certain mental health conditions. [cite: LSPC 4-401]

sections.name: Carrying a Concealed Weapon
sections.text: Carrying a concealed firearm or deadly weapon without a valid permit. **Concealed carry** violations include improper licensing or carrying in prohibited areas. [cite: LSPC 4-402]

sections.name: Assault with a Firearm
sections.text: Committing an assault while armed with a firearm. **Armed assault** carries enhanced penalties due to the use of firearms and increased danger to victims and public safety. [cite: LSPC 4-403]

sections.name: Discharge of Firearm in Public
sections.text: Unlawfully discharging a firearm in any public place, inhabited area, or in a manner that endangers others. **Reckless discharge** includes warning shots and celebratory gunfire. [cite: LSPC 4-404]

sections.name: Sale of Illegal Weapons
sections.text: Unlawfully selling, transferring, or distributing firearms, ammunition, or prohibited weapons without proper licensing. **Illegal gun sales** include straw purchases and unlicensed dealing. [cite: LSPC 4-405]

sections.name: Possession of Prohibited Weapons
sections.text: Possession of weapons prohibited by law including automatic firearms, explosive devices, armor-piercing ammunition, and certain knives. **Prohibited weapons** are banned due to public safety concerns. [cite: LSPC 4-406]

title: TITLE 5. PUBLIC ORDER AND SAFETY OFFENSES

sections.name: Disturbing the Peace
sections.text: Unlawfully fighting, using offensive words in public, or making loud and unreasonable noise that disturbs others. **Disturbing the peace** includes public arguments, loud music, and disruptive behavior. [cite: LSPC 5-501]

sections.name: Public Intoxication
sections.text: Being in any public place while under the influence of alcohol or drugs to such a degree as to be unable to care for oneself or others, or to create a public disturbance. [cite: LSPC 5-502]

sections.name: Loitering
sections.text: Remaining in a public place for an extended period without apparent purpose, especially when such presence is likely to cause alarm or is in violation of posted restrictions. [cite: LSPC 5-503]

sections.name: Trespassing
sections.text: Unlawfully entering or remaining on the property of another after being forbidden to do so. **Criminal trespass** includes entering posted private property and remaining after being asked to leave. [cite: LSPC 5-504]

sections.name: Resisting Arrest
sections.text: Willfully resisting, delaying, or obstructing a law enforcement officer in the discharge of their duties. **Resisting arrest** includes physical resistance and failure to comply with lawful orders. [cite: LSPC 5-505]

sections.name: Obstruction of Justice
sections.text: Willfully interfering with or obstructing the administration of justice including tampering with evidence, intimidating witnesses, or providing false information to authorities. [cite: LSPC 5-506]

sections.name: Reckless Driving
sections.text: Operating a vehicle with willful or wanton disregard for the safety of persons or property. **Reckless driving** includes excessive speeding, racing, and dangerous maneuvers. [cite: LSPC 5-507]

sections.name: Driving Under the Influence
sections.text: Operating a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol, drugs, or any combination thereof that impairs driving ability. **DUI** penalties increase with prior convictions and blood alcohol level. [cite: LSPC 5-508]
